name: Dextrose
contraindications: Known or suspected stroke in the absence of hypoglycemia

pedi: [PM2] > 2 yoa D50 1mL/kg max 25g {IV/IO} repeat as needed

duration: Depends on the degree of hypoglycemia
pearls: The patency and function of the IV line should be verified prior to administration. D50% should be administered slow IV push
When glucose is administered to patients with a known or suspected history of alcohol abuse or malnutrition, thiamine should also be administered (see thiamine for more information)
Because higher concentration solutions are hypertonic and their extravasation my lead to tissue injury, D10% is the preferred preparation for the management of hypoglycemia in the field
[PM2] [AM2] In extreme circumstances with no IV and no response to glucagon, Dextrose 50 % can be administered rectally. Contact medical control for advice.
[PM2] Can dilute D50 into D10 by mixing with Normal Saline with a 4 normal saline to 1 D50 ratio (1mL D50 with 4mL NS)
[PM2] Can dilute D50 into D25 by mixing with Normal Saline with a 1-1 ration (1mL D50 with 1mL NS)
